casebody.data:
Joseph GOLDSTEIN, Plaintiff in Error, v. UNITED STATES, Defendant in Error. (Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. May 18, 1925.) No. 351. Lind & Marks, of New York City (Alfred D. Lind and Norman L. Marks, both of New York City, of counsel), for plaintiff in error. Emory R. Buckner, U. S. Atty., of New York City (Morris D. Reiss, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for the United States.

Before ROGERS, HOUGH, and HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Judgment affirmed.
